Title: [Discord Overlay] Input of Polish "ą" and "ż" characters results in improper behaviour of the draft messages in text box
Info:
Reported by Tokuś#9145

####Steps to reproduce:
- Change keyboard input to Polish (Programmer/Programisty)

- Start typing any message in the text box 
- Type "ą" or "ż" characters 
- Observe the behaviour of the message

####Expected result:
User can write a message with all Polish characters without text formatting issues
####Actual result:
Typing "ą" with keyboard deletes the entire draft of the message. Typing "ż" switches the character to "ź" and adds a previously deleted character
####Client settings:

####System settings:
Windows 10 Pro 64-bit (10.0, 17134)

Ascendancy#1111 - Bug Bot on 2018-11-02T17:32:30.384Z


### Can reproduce.
Microsoft Windows [Version 10.0.17134.320] , [BUILD INFO] Release Channel: canary, Build Number: 25412, Version Hash: afc03a98fc5f225b7d4791c93556a490678f392c | Reproduceable for any Cyrillic character

Fixator10#7133 - Bug Bot on 2018-10-04T04:11:29.420Z


### Can reproduce.
Windows 10 x64 1803 (17134.285), Canary 24461 
Can repro with Latvian (Standard) keyboard when pressing `AltGr-A`, or `AltGr-Z`. However, when pressing `'` (quote) followed by A or Z result is as expected. Additionally, AltGr-C copies selected text, but `­'` (quote) followed by C does not.
Suspecting conflict with AltGr being technically Ctrl+LeftAlt, thus firing select all, undo, copy Windows hotkeys before entering the character. Because a `ż` or `ž` character is entered after firing undo, redo is no longer available. On the other hand, after replacing all text with `ą` or `ā` it is possible to Ctrl-Z to bring back what the text was before replacing.
For Latvian users workaround can be to use Latvian (Standard) keyboard instead of or alongside Latvian (QWERTY) and type with `'` (quote) rather than AltGr, and for Polish keyboards (214) types `ą` and `ż` as expected, but is unfortunately a QWERTZ layout.

Title: [Archived] Overlay causes Minecraft Crashes
Info:
Reported by DeJay#1337

####Steps to reproduce:
- Using Device Manager's "Display Adapters" tab please ensure you have the following hardware requirements: An integrated Intel Graphics Card and an nVidia GeForce Card on the same device (Any generation of both) *See attachments for examples* 
- Ensure your integrated Graphics Card is not disabled or "uninstalled"  
- Enable the Discord Overlay either before running the game, or after the game starts (Found by lieuwe_berg#8662) 
- Start any version of non modified (Vanilla) Minecraft

####Expected result:
The game should complete it's startup and notify the user that the Discord Overlay is available with their selected keybinds.
####Actual result:
The game either completes startup and doesnt notify the user of the overlay (and the bug must be forced by interacting with a part of the title screen) or the game doesnt complete startup at all. This is due to Discords inability to determine what graphics card Minecraft is using (see attachments)
####Client settings:
Discord Canary 0.0.211 (Build 20540)
####System settings:
Windows 10 Home (1803) x64

16798
